text: {"answer":"C","reasoning":"i is incorrect because Swiss civil procedure generally relies on court-appointed experts; party experts are treated as party allegations/documents rather than full expert evidence. ii is incorrect because legal sociology is empirical/social-scientific and does not follow the same formal-dogmatic logic as legal doctrine. v is incorrect because recognition/enforcement in Switzerland generally requires reciprocity for certain matters (notably foreign insolvency decrees under Swiss PILA), so it is not irrespective of reciprocal treatment."}
